metadata.title: CVE-2017-9869 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - negligible.
metadata.description:
The II_step_one function in layer2.c in mpglib, as used in libmpgdecoder.a in LAME 3.99.5 and other products, allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (buffer over-read and application crash) via a crafted audio file.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2017-9869` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

lame - 3.100-2
libmp3lame0 - 3.100-2
No subscription required

notes.note: ratliff> reproducer doesn't crash on t-z (no ASAN)

criterions.comment: lame package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.100-2').
